title: Boston Legacy FC announces New Kids on the Block halftime show for home opener
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston Legacy FC's first home game on March 14 includes New Kids on the Block halftime show at Gillette Stadium.
Over 20,000 tickets sold, anticipated as one of the largest crowds in NWSL history, marking a memorable city event.
New Kids on the Block will perform hits like 'Hangin’ Tough' and 'Step By Step', celebrating their Boston roots.

title: Blizzard leaves Cape Cod buried and struggling to recover
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: As much as 37 inches of snow hit Barnstable County, causing widespread power outages affecting hundreds of thousands.
Emergency shelters and warming centers on Cape Cod reach capacity as frail residents struggle without power or internet.
Eversource deploying 900 crews to restore power by Thursday; internet and cell services also disrupted.

title: Man killed while clearing snow from vehicle on Mass. Turnpike
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A 35-year-old from Vernon, Connecticut, was killed while clearing snow from his vehicle on the Mass. Turnpike.
Patrick Sarpong was struck by a tractor-trailer near mile marker 104.6 on Interstate 90 in Hopkinton, police said.
Despite emergency medical treatment, Sarpong died at a nearby hospital, according to Massachusetts State Police.

title: Healey lifts travel ban for southeastern counties
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Gov. Maura Healey lifted the travel ban for Bristol, Plymouth, Barnstable, and Dukes counties following a historic blizzard.
More than 30 inches of snow fell in parts of eastern Massachusetts, causing widespread power outages, impacting over 250,000 customers.
Up to 350 National Guard members activated to aid in rescue and recovery; additional support requested from out-of-state agencies.

title: ICE scraps plans for N.H. detention center, Ayotte says
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: ICE cancels plans for a detention center in Merrimack, N.H., following discussions between Governor Kelly Ayotte and DHS Secretary Kristi Noem.
The proposed facility faced backlash, with protests from 1,500 residents and pushback from local and state officials, including some Republicans.
The project was part of ICE's $38.3 billion Detention Reengineering Initiative to create detention centers nationwide, aiming for completion by Fiscal Year 2026.

title: Cocaine levels in Nantucket’s wastewater are growing exponentially. No one is sure exactly why.
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Cocaine levels in Nantucket's wastewater surged to 100% above the national average by November 2025.
Despite major cocaine busts, police observe the drug's presence isn't evident in daily law enforcement activities.
Wastewater data suggests possible cocaine disposals as benzoylecgonine levels don't match cocaine spikes.

title: Readers across Massachusetts share photos from Monday’s blizzard
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Massachusetts blizzard on Monday dumped over 30 inches of snow in parts, causing low visibility and strong winds.
Boston.com readers shared photos showing snow-covered streets, pets in the snow, and sledders in deep drifts.
Photos featured locations such as Harvard's BioLabs in Cambridge and Porter Square in Somerville during the storm.

title: Massport: ‘There will be delays’ Tuesday at Logan Airport after the blizzard
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Logan Airport experienced 454 cancellations and 51 delays Tuesday following a Monday nor’easter affecting the Northeast.
Massport advises checking flight status and allowing extra travel time as Logan resumes flights after 16.9 inches of snow.
JetBlue is waiving change and cancel fees for travelers affected by the storm from February 22 to February 26, 2026.

title: First responders in Cohasset carry patient with snowblower injury to ambulance, which then got stuck
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: First responders in Cohasset carried a snowblower injury victim to an ambulance during a blizzard.
The ambulance became stuck and required shoveling to continue transporting the patient.
By Monday night, over 1,000 Cohasset residents were without power, with roads blocked by trees and wires.

title: Review & setlist: Margo Price shows just enough country contrariness at Royale
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Margo Price performed at the Royale in Boston on Feb. 22, showcasing her unique take on country music.
Price's set included covers of Woody Guthrie and Bob Dylan, alongside her originals like 'Hands Of Time'.
Opening act Pearl Charles delivered a 70s-style Pacific coast folk-pop performance to start the evening.
